intro: Pentagonia hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy pentagonia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and vines. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves with a distinctive pentagonal shape, giving it its scientific name. It produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in terminal inflorescences. Pentagonia hirsuta is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky slopes.
